Member Function Documentation

AccountsData * AccountsData::instance (   )  [static]
 

Retrieve the single instance of this class.

Client should start this instance, and use AccountsData::destroy() inside its destructor.

void AccountsData::destroy (   ) 
 

Destroy the single instance of this class.

Should only be used by Client.

Initiate the class.

vector< AccountsData::Account * > AccountsData::getAllAccounts (   )  const
 

Retrieve all data for all accounts.

void AccountsData::updateAccount (  const Q_UINT16  key,
const QString  id,
const QString  desc
) 
 

Update an account.

This function updates an existing account or inserts a new account if the "key" is not found in the account database. Requires an identifying key, and the new data.

Note:
This update does not work on the retained earnings account. Use AccountsData::updateREAccount() instead.

void AccountsData::deleteAccount (  const Q_UINT16  key  ) 
 

Delete an account.

Requires an identifying key

Note:
If the account contains associated data in the journal or journal entry it will not be deleted. Use AccountsData::accountHasEntries() to check for this condition (and tell the user).

Q_UINT16 AccountsData::getNextAccountKey (   )  const
 

Retrieve a new account key.

To create a new account, grab this key, then use it in an update.

void AccountsData::setREAccount (  const QString  id  ) 
 

Set which account is considered the retained earnings account.

This function will do nothing if a retained earnings account has already been specified.

QStringList AccountsData::getFormattedList (   )  const
 

Retrieve just a list of accounts.

The strings are in the format: "id - desc"

QString AccountsData::getDescription (  const QString  id  )  const
 

Retrieve just the description for a particluar account.

void AccountsData::accountsChanged (   )  [signal]
 

Emitted when the "accounts" table has changed.
